Key Match Events: Jusuf Nurkic made the second of two free throws with 0.8 seconds left, lifting the Phoenix Suns to a 114-113 victory over the Dallas Mavericks.
Kevin Durant scored 26 points, and Nurkic had 15 points and 10 rebounds.
Luka Doncic had 30 points, seven assists, and seven rebounds.
Daniel Gafford got Dallas even at 113 on an alley-oop dunk from Luka Doncic.
Royce O'Neale missed a runner in the lane in the final seconds, but Nurkic grabbed the rebound and was fouled.
Doncic was short on a desperation 3-pointer at the buzzer.
O'Neale scored 18 points for Phoenix, and Devin Booker had 13 points and 12 assists.
Kyrie Irving scored 29 points, and Naji Marshall had 18 for Dallas.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Phoenix didn't have a huge edge in offensive rebounds at 11-8, but six of them came in the fourth quarter. Nurkic had all three of his in the fourth.
The Suns are home against Sacramento on Sunday. The Mavericks are at Denver on Sunday night.
